repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body: ### Problem: Currently, the default progress message doesn't account for message-status. Also, the title and percent sections don't get written to history. Additionally progress percent is hard to find due to variable length messages. ### Solution: Apply highlighting on Title based on status. And sync the formated msg in history too. Also updates the default progress message format to {title}: {percent}% msg. ### Sample: Follow-up on #35527

comment_data.body: Maybe using `ModeMsg` when running is better? It more or less fits the highlight group name (default "mode") and adds green stand-out highlighting with default color scheme.
typo. please look for typos in the rest of the changes
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -292,14 +292,60 @@ void msg_multiline(String str, int hl_id, bool check_int, bool hist, bool *need_
 // Avoid starting a new message for each chunk and adding message to history in msg_keep().
 static bool is_multihl = false;
 
+/// Format a progress message, adding title and percent if given.
+///
+/// @param hl_msg Message chunks
+/// @param msg_data Additional data for progress messages
+static HlMessage fomrat_progress_message(HlMessage hl_msg, MessageData *msg_data)

comment_data.body:
Maybe we should use ModeMsg for success and MoreMsg for running.

Is ModeMsg generally painted green?
No. I'd suggest instead using the basic diagnostic colors for this (esp. `Ok` for success) -- or even introduce a new set of "Log" groups (linked to existing groups by default).

> Maybe we should use ModeMsg for success and MoreMsg for running.

Fine by me. I just initially liked the green-yellow, but cyan-yellow should also be fine.

> Is ModeMsg generally painted green?

No, not really. It is mostly up to color scheme author to decide.

> Is ModeMsg generally painted green?

could use `DiagnosticOk`. eventually we probably should add ~~SuccessMsg~~ `OkMsg`, analogous to `ErrorMsg` and `WarningMsg`. https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/32646

> could use `DiagnosticOk`. eventually we probably should add `SuccessMsg`, analogous to `ErrorMsg` and `WarningMsg`. #32646

Yes, indeed `DiagnosticOk` is usually green. The one small/possible issue with it is that it might not fit well as part of message area. Usually groups starting/ending with `Msg` are the ones used for this. In theory color schemes can define `DiagnosticOk` to have a dedicated background that doesn't match message area.

It probably still okay to use `MoreMsg` (cyan by default) for "running" and `DiagnosticOk` for "success".
Then I suggest adding an `OkMsg` group (to keep the Ok->Warn->Err pattern across groups) with the same definition as `DiagnosticOk` for the default colorscheme.

> Then I suggest adding an `OkMsg` group (to keep the Ok->Warn->Err pattern across groups) with the same definition as `DiagnosticOk` for the default colorscheme.

Yeah, good idea. I wonder if it is worth linking it by default to `DiagnosticOk`; for better compatibility and to not force color scheme authors to set it. Just thinking out loud :thinking:

Seems to be not too clean to mix these together. So yeah, have `OkMsg` that has the same default definition as `ModeMsg` should be okay. Also needs a 'news.txt' update to mention it.
Linking was my first thought as well, but I checked and we don't link any of the other groups in this group (ha!) so thought we should stay consistent.
Let's add OkMsg for this. That sounds most appropriate.

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -375,6 +375,7 @@ static const char *highlight_init_light[] = {
   "MoreMsg              guifg=NvimDarkCyan                                   ctermfg=6",
   "NonText              guifg=NvimLightGrey4",
   "NormalFloat                               guibg=NvimLightGrey1",
+  "OkMsg             guifg=NvimDarkGreen                    ctermfg=2",

comment_data.body:
This is a total nit pick and I apologize for that.

Could you please use `": "` without special highlighting? Having it highlighted the same way as title 1) makes it look like intentional part of title (which it is not, it is a separator); and 2) might be unwanted if color scheme decides to have these highlighted with colored background (in which case a space will also be highlighted, which is too much).

comment_regular_data.body:
Visually and with used highlight groups looks nice :+1:

Would you mind showing demo with default color scheme (`:color default`)?

> Visually and with used highlight groups looks nice 
> 
> Would you mind showing demo with default color scheme (`:color default`)?

updated the screenshot.

> the title and percent sections don't get written to history.

Since progress messages can be pretty noisy, ideally only one message would be saved to history. Is it hard to "shift" the old history message (i.e. delete and add to bottom of history) for a given message-id? That was one reason for storing the message-id.

> Since progress messages can be pretty noisy, ideally only one message would be saved to history. Is it hard to "shift" the old history message (i.e. delete and add to bottom of history) for a given message-id?

I suggested not to do that in #34846. The API already has a `history` flag, so doing something implicitly for progress messages seems unnecessary. Presumably the caller knows which of the progress messages could be relevant for the history. E.g. I imagine the first and last message could both be useful to keep, which would be lost if we implicitly update the message in the history.

> I suggested not to do that in #34846. The API already has a `history` flag, so doing something implicitly for progress messages seems unnecessary. Presumably the caller knows which of the progress messages could be relevant for the history. E.g. I imagine the first and last message could both be useful to keep, which would be lost if we implicitly update the message in the history.

Oh, I see. That's a good point. I'll add first and last progress messages to history in `vim.pack`.
With "ModeMsg" as highlighting for running status, it looks like this by default.

> Since progress messages can be pretty noisy, ideally only one message would be saved to history. Is it hard to "shift" the old history message (i.e. delete and add to bottom of history) for a given message-id

It's not hard. We had it on #34846. It was dropped in favor of following "history" param as [luukvbaal](https://github.com/luukvbaal) said.
with OkMsg as success and MoreMsg as running this is what it looks like
without hightlighting on ':'
Nice work! `vim.pack` and maybe even LSP can start using this. We can improve it as we discover stuff.
